revision.text:
{{cleanup rewrite|date=October 2016}} {{Infobox settlement |name = {{raise|0.2em|Gaozhou}} |official_name = <!-- Official name in English if different from 'name' --> |native_name = {{lower|0.1em|{{nobold|{{lang|zh|高州市}}}}}} |other_name = Kochow |postal_code = 525200 |postal_code_type = [[Postal code of China|Postal code]] |seat = [[Panzhou]] ({{lang|zh|潘州}}) |seat_type = County seat |settlement_type = [[County-level city|County-level]] & [[Sub-prefecture-level city|Sub-prefectural city]] |image_skyline = Panzhoupark2.jpg |image_map = |map_caption = |pushpin_map = China Guangdong |pushpin_label = |pushpin_map_caption = Location in Guangdong |subdivision_type = Country |subdivision_name = [[People's Republic of China]] |subdivision_type1 = [[Province (China)|Province]] |subdivision_name1 = [[Guangdong]] |subdivision_type2 = [[Prefecture-level city]] |subdivision_name2 = [[Maoming]] |area_code = 0668 |area_total_km2 = 3276 |population = |population_as_of = 2010 census<ref>http://www.citypopulation.de/php/china-guangdong-admin.php</ref> |population_density_km2 = auto |population_total = 1288665 |coordinates = {{coord|21|55|28|N|110|50|32|E|type:adm3rd_region:CN-44|display=inline,title}} |elevation_ft = |elevation_m = |timezone = [[China Standard Time|China Standard]] |utc_offset = +8 |website = [http://www.gaozhou.gov.cn/ www.gaozhou.gov.cn] }} {{Infobox Chinese |pic=File:Pearl River Yujitu.png |piccap=Gaozhou and [[Panzhou]] on the 1136 [[Yuji Tu]] |c={{linktext|高州}} |p= Gāozhōu |y=Kochow |l={{nowrap|High [[zhou (administrative division)|Prefecture]]}} }} '''Gaozhou''' is a [[county (China)|county]]-level [[county-level city|city]] in southwestern [[Guangdong]] [[Provinces of China|Province]], China. Formerly the primary city in the area, it is now administered as part of the [[prefecture (China)|prefecture]]-level [[prefecture-level city|city]] of [[Maoming]]. At the time of the [[2010 Chinese census|2010 census]], Gaozhou had a population of 1,288,665 living in its {{convert|3276|sqkm|abbr=on|sp=us|adj=on}} territory.<ref name=Gaozhou_Statistic_2009>{{Cite web| url=http://gztjw.com/MANAGE/manage/news/news_show.asp?id=331 | title=Maoming Economic and Social Development Report | publisher=Bureau of Statistics of Gaozhou | accessdate=2010-04-19}}</ref> The locals speak a variation of the [[Gaozhou dialect]]. It is best known in China for being the [[Ancestral veneration in China|ancestral home]] of [[Leo Ku]].
==History== Gaozhou is a historically important city in [[Guangdong]]. Under the [[Qing dynasty|Qing]], it was the seat of {{nowrap|'''Gaozhou [[fu (administrative division)|Commandery]]''',}} overseeing [[Dianbai District|Dianbai]], [[Huazhou, Guangdong|Huazhou]], [[Maoming]], "Sih-ching", [[Wuchuan, Guangdong|Wuchuan]], and [[Xinyi, Guangdong|Xinyi]] [[county (China)|Counties]].<ref>{{citation |last=Gützlaff |first=Charles |authorlink=Karl Gützlaff |editor=Andrew Reed |display-editors=0 |url=https://books.google.com.hk/books?id=iO5AAAAAcAAJ |p=[https://books.google.com.hk/books?id=iO5AAAAAcAAJ&pg=PA527 527] |title=China Opened }}.</ref> After the [[Chinese Civil War]], it was placed under the administration of Maoming as {{nowrap|'''Gaozhou County'''}} and then promoted to county-level city status in 1993.
==Administration== Administratively, Gaozhou is a county-level city under the jurisdiction of the provincial-level city [[Maoming]] in Guangdong Province. The city of Gaozhou consists of five districts (Panzhou, Shanmei, Baoguang, Shizailing, and Jinshan); the county includes another 23 towns.
==Geography== Gaozhou is located {{convert|420|km|abbr=on}} away from [[Shenzhen]] and [[Guangzhou]], {{convert|450|km|abbr=on}} away from [[Hong Kong]].
==Transportation== *[[China National Highway 207]] *[[China National expressway G65]]
